Here's when the diseases will get you (statistically):

```{python}
#| echo: false
import pandas as pd

# Personal risk calculator
def calculate_death_risk(age_group):
    risks = {
        'Heart Disease': {'20-40': 5, '40-60': 25, '60-80': 45, '80+': 60},
        'Cancer': {'20-40': 8, '40-60': 30, '60-80': 35, '80+': 25},
        'Alzheimer\'s': {'20-40': 0, '40-60': 2, '60-80': 15, '80+': 35},
        'Diabetes': {'20-40': 3, '40-60': 8, '60-80': 12, '80+': 10},
        'Accident': {'20-40': 15, '40-60': 5, '60-80': 3, '80+': 2},
        'Other': {'20-40': 69, '40-60': 30, '60-80': 15, '80+': 8}
    }

    return risks

# Create visualization
age_groups = ['20-40', '40-60', '60-80', '80+']
risks = calculate_death_risk(age_groups[0])

print("YOUR LIKELIHOOD OF DYING FROM EACH CAUSE (%):\n")
for age in age_groups:
    print(f"\nüìä Age {age}:")
    age_risks = {disease: risks[disease][age] for disease in risks}
    sorted_risks = sorted(age_risks.items(), key=lambda x: x[1], reverse=True)
    for disease, risk in sorted_risks[:4]:
        if risk > 0:
            bar = '‚ñà' * (risk // 2)
            print(f"   {disease}: {bar} {risk}%")
```
